snippet: The failure to act against some autocratic leaders challenged by the Arab Spring is emboldening critics who see the court as part of a deeply undemocratic international order.
abstract: Failure of the International Criminal Court to act against some autocratic leaders challenged by the Arab Spring has emboldened critics who say many war criminals are not prosecuted because they have powerful allies with ties to the court; frustration threatens to undermine the still-fragile international consensus that formed the basis for the court’s creation in 2002.
lead_paragraph: The failure to act against some autocratic leaders challenged by the Arab Spring is emboldening critics who see the court as part of a deeply undemocratic international order.

headline.seo: Arab Spring Reveals International Court Flaws
headline.main: Arab Uprisings Point Up Flaws in Global Court
headline.print_headline: Arab Uprisings Point Up Flaws In Global Court
